```{r echo=FALSE,results="hide"}
library(knitr)
```

## Introduction

Below you find example code for the package...

```{r}
library(enrigo)
getwd()
list.files()
list.files("..")
goutil$download(2023)
list.files()
Sys.time()
goutil$new("2023-01-01-go.obo")
Sys.time()
list.files()
ls(goutil)
```

A GO image retrieved from the EBI QuickGO webservice :

![](`r goutil$quickGO('GO:0003676')`)

An other GO image retrieved from the Kroki webservice using PlantUML :

![](`r goutil$kroki('GO:0003676')`)


## Plot example

```{r fig=TRUE,fig.width=6,fig.height=6}
goutil$quickGO('GO:0003676',plot=TRUE)
```

```{r fig=TRUE,fig.width=6,fig.height=6}
goutil$kroki('GO:0003676',plot=TRUE)
```

```{r fig=TRUE,fig.width=9,fig.height=6}
data(iris)
par(mfrow=c(1,2),mai=rep(0.8,4))
plot(iris$Sepal.Width~iris$Sepal.Length,
    col=as.numeric(iris$Species)+1,pch=15)
plot(iris$Petal.Width~iris$Petal.Length,
    col=as.numeric(iris$Species)+1,pch=15)
```

## Table Example

```{r results="asis"}
knitr::kable(head(iris))
```

## Inline expression

The dataset iris has `r nrow(iris)` plants.
